content.rendered:
Our Vision

The GNY Range Report is the center of gravity for the GNY.io blockchain project. A crypto intelligence hub that showcases our research and insights at the intersection of blockchain and machine learning. The GNY Range Report is our vehicle for developing this vision as we combine the security and auditability of blockchain with the insights and unstoppable inertia of machine learning and AI.

You can read more about the team’s long-term vision in the Roadmap section, but below are the profiles of our team members. These profiles showcase the expertise not only from both the blockchain and machine learning arenas, but also from the financial, legal, and regulatory landscapes that inform our project.

Throughout the rest of the website, you can learn more about what’s next in our tech pipeline, how to make the most of our current free crypto intelligence services, and the GNY utility token that will eventually power our entire system.

Team Bios

Cosmas Wong – Founder and CEO

Cosmas is a visionary London-based tech investor and entrepreneur with over two decades of experience in building successful companies. With his roots as a corporate finance and private equity lawyer in London, Cosmas has worked with both large enterprises and nimble startups around the globe, gaining a profound understanding of their inner workings.

Cosmas has an unwavering passion for cutting-edge, data-driven solutions that empower businesses to thrive in the digital age. In 2010, he co-founded Enso Financial Management LLP, a trailblazing New York-based financial services data platform catering to the world’s largest hedge funds. This groundbreaking venture caught the attention of industry giants and led to the eventual acquisition by iCap plc in 2016.

Fueling his fascination with data solutions, artificial intelligence, and the revolutionary potential of blockchain technology, Cosmas then ventured into the realm of machine learning predictive technologies. In New York, heestablished Grey Jean Technologies, where his team harnessed the power of advanced algorithms to create innovative solutions for retail and publishing sectors.

In 2018, Cosmas’s forward-thinking mindset led him to found the GNY platform in Jersey, UK. GNY became the first utility token to embark on an initial coin offering under the island’s pioneering ICO guidelines. Leveraging his expertise in data, machine learning solutions, and his financial and legal background, Cosmas has been the driving force behind the expansion and development of GNY’s predictive platform amidst the ever-evolving crypto landscape.

Richard Jarritt – Founder and Chief R&D Officer

Richard is a renowned figure in the world of cryptocurrencies and open-source blockchain projects. With an exceptional talent for assembling exceptional teams, Richard is a specialist in back-end coding for crypto exchanges, masternode sharing, governance control solutions, and network maintenance.

Richard’s reputation precedes him, as he has left an indelible mark on numerous open-source blockchain initiatives. His expertise and technical prowess have propelled him to the forefront of the industry, where he has made significant contributions to the development of various successful blockchain projects and crypto exchanges.

However, Richard’s ambitions extend far beyond the realm of blockchain enthusiasts. He possesses an unwavering passion for bringing the transformative power of blockchain technology to traditional businesses.
With a laser focus on technological solutions, Richard strives to enhance accessibility and foster innovation for enterprises seeking to integrate blockchain into their operations.

In 2018, Richard joined Cosmas and co-founded GNY.IO Limited. Richard’s journey is marked by a series of achievements and milestones, each one reinforcing his dedication to driving the adoption and utilization of blockchain technology. His unwavering commitment to this revolutionary field continues to shape the landscape of blockchain technology, cryptocurrencies, and open-source projects.

Zachary Barnett – Head of Operations

Zach is an experienced social entrepreneur with 10+ years’ experience in strategic planning, fund-raising, partnerships, and media campaigns to grow great ideas into transformational products. He excels at finding creative solutions for business development challenges that deliver results, and provide value for all partners.

Zach has a passion for communicating and translating complex scientific, and technical information into content that engages other brands, and customers. Previously, Zach partnered with immunological researchers to advance innovative catalytic antibody research with Abzyme Research Foundation.

After joining the GNY Team, Zach enrolled in MIT’s Applied Data Science Program to better understand the fundamentals and potential areas of new value that AI and machine learning can bring to blockchain environments.

Completing this program unlocked Zach’s full ability to marry the needs for centralized, easy-to-use, and powerful ML-powered insights with the capacities and limitations of machine learning and AI technologies.

Zach’s role connects the entire team and allows for accelerated product innovation and development as well as the growing integration of AI in every aspect of the GNY Range Report.

Peter Davies – Chairman

Peter is a multifaceted individual whose diverse career has spanned education, business management and the law.

From his career beginnings as a teacher, Peter’s journey has been nothing short of extraordinary. After a period in the classroom, Peter undertook UK government-funded research into national literacy standards, before taking on a senior role in one of the UK’s oldest and most distinguished educational publishing companies, Thomas Nelson & Sons.

However, a thirst for new challenges led him to make a bold pivot, as he decided to embark on a path of legal studies. With an unyielding determination, Peter pursued his legal education and earned qualification as a member of the esteemed English bar in 1982. This transition opened doors to a remarkable legal career that would be defined by his exceptional contributions to the technology sector.

As an in-house counsel, he served prominent technology companies such as Microsoft, IBM, and, ultimately, Apple Europe, where he was Director of Legal and Regulatory Affairs until his retirement. As a founding vice-president of the trade association the Business Software Alliance, Peter’s expertise and reputation have extended far beyond his role as an in-house counsel. He played an influential role in the technology industry, acting as its voice in dialogue with governments and regulatory bodies across Europe.

As an industry spokesman, he has shared his invaluable insights as an external expert advisor to major international bodies such as the OECD, the UN International Development Law Agency, and the European Commission.

In recognition of his expertise and breadth of experience, Peter was appointed Visiting Fellow at the prestigious Oxford Internet Institute at Oxford University.

In his current role as Chairman of GNY.IO Limited, Peter continues to showcase his visionary leadership. Guiding the company through the intricate web of newly established legislation and regulatory frameworks surrounding cryptocurrencies and AI, Peter’s expertise is instrumental in navigating this fast-moving and highly-charged area of legal and public policy debate

Philip Bisson – Director

Philip is a distinguished professional with an impressive track record in the financial services industry in Jersey.

As a Fellow of the Institute of Bankers and a member of esteemed organizations such as the International Tax Planning Association and the Society of Trust and Estate Practitioners, and the Treasurer of the Jersey Association of Trust Companies, Philip’s expertise is second to none. With a Diploma in Hedge Fund Administration, he possesses specialized knowledge in this complex field.

In 1994, Philip established Philean Trust Company Limited, building upon his previous accomplishments of setting up BT Trustees (Jersey) Limited for Bankers Trust and managing Chase Bank and Trust Company (CI) Ltd for Chase Manhattan Bank. Prior to these endeavors, he gained valuable experience at Hill Samuel (CI) Trust Co Ltd and National Westminster Jersey Trust Company.

Throughout his career, Philip has been sought after for his strategic guidance and advisory services, both for established companies and promising startups. His insights and support have been instrumental in their growth and success.

Notably, he demonstrated foresight as an early investor in Enso Financial Management LLP, Grey Jean Technologies LLC, and GNY.IO, recognizing their potential early on and contributing to their development.

With his deep expertise in the financial industry, and a strong foundation in trust and estate planning, as well as hedge fund administration, Philip has established himself as a trusted advisor and an influential figure in the world of finance.

Dan Ames – Head Technical Architect

Dan’s career journey is characterized by his unwavering dedication to learning and his deep passion for technology. He began teaching himself to code in 1986, demonstrating his innate curiosity and commitment to mastering new skills at a young age.

In the late 90s, Dan developed a proof of concept for wireless energy meters and played a role in developing one of the first voice over IP consumer applications.

In 2001, Dan joined a venture capital company where he made significant contributions to an innovative project utilizing geolocation on Blackberry smartphones.

At Barclays Bank in 2003, Dan rolled out a large-scale service and supplier management system, earning him his first ITIL qualification. In 2005, Dan entered the healthcare sector as a financial analyst within the NHS. He showcased his analytical skills and ability to handle complex data by working on information reporting for large healthcare contracts. In 2010, Dan was appointed as the IT Operations Manager for a London-based region of the NHS, providing network, server, and support services to numerous healthcare facilities, including managing critical IT infrastructure.

In 2012, Dan’s fascination with decentralized systems led him to blockchain technology. As the Test & Release Manager for Darkcoin/Dash, he oversaw the testing and rollout of the first layer 2 system on a blockchain, showcasing his technical acumen and ability to lead innovative projects. He continued to work on blockchain-related projects as a freelancer, focusing on zero knowledge proofs, peer-to-peer lending systems, and delegated proof of stake implementations.

During the past five years, Dan dedicated his spare time to developing his own blockchain technology, focusing on probabilistic on-chain transactions without smart contracts.

In 2021, Dan joined GNY with the responsibility of developing the technical maturity of the company’s IT systems and processes. He implemented Freshdesk and ITIL-aligned support processes to ensure efficient management of IT systems and services as GNY scales. Dan also took a lead role in developing the machine learning infrastructure, utilizing AWS Lambda and Eventbridge for containerization and automation. He collaborated with external consultants on the development of new models. With a passion for process efficiency, business continuity, and scalability, Dan designed and co-developed various systems to support GNY’s products and services. He applied his decade of blockchain experience to guide the blockchain roadmap and maintain a focus on blockchain use cases, ensuring the utility of the GNY blockchain and token in the future.

Outside of work, Dan is an avid mountaineer and amateur sportsperson, showcasing his discipline and determination. He is also passionate about radio communications and has contributed to open-source satellite communication projects, combining his knowledge of radio communications and physics with his IT career.

Fabian Olesen, Data Architect

Fabian is a true pioneer in the world of cryptocurrency, with a decade-long journey that has left a profound impact on the crypto landscape. His story began in 2009 when he mined the first Bitcoin on his modest laptop, showcasing an early understanding and curiosity for the potential of this emerging technology.

Since then, Fabian has immersed themselves in the world of cryptocurrencies. In 2014, he became deeply involved with Dash, a renowned digital currency renowned for its privacy focus and fast transactions. Fabian didn’t simply observe from the sidelines; he actively participated in the growth and development of Dash. He ventured into creating masternodes, essential components of Dash’s network infrastructure that enable enhanced transaction validation and governance functions.

Fabian further elevated his expertise by running Bitcoin miners and even managing a mining pool. His dedication to the mining process showcased their technical proficiency and unwavering commitment to the security and stability of the cryptocurrency networks they engaged with. As a result, he gained invaluable insights into the intricate workings of blockchain technology. Recognizing the need for user-friendly solutions in the crypto space, Fabian pioneered the creation of the first-ever masternode hosting platform. Thisgroundbreaking platform simplified the process of setting up and managing masternodes, making it accessible to a wider audience. Fabian’s innovative mindset and ability to bridge cutting-edge technology with user-friendly experiences were on full display through this endeavor.
Beyond their contributions to Dash and masternodes, Fabian has been an invaluable asset to various cryptocurrency projects. Fabian actively participated in the development and launch of multiple tokens, showcasing his skills as a developer and their unyielding passion for exploring new frontiers within the crypto ecosystem.

Fabian played a crucial role in curating the data used in the reports generated by GNY Range Report. Fabian ensured that the reports contained consistently reliable and comprehensive information – complex information in the charts were delivered and in an intuitive and user-friendly manner, enhancing the readability and understanding of the reports, enabling users to easily grasp and interpret the information presented.

James Kilkelly – Marketing & Community Manager

James possesses a deep understanding of the importance of nurturing individuals and fostering growth within communities, particularly on a global scale. With a diverse background in communication, he leverages his experience as a journalist, higher education tutor, and author to educate, support, and inspire both readers and listeners.

In 2017, James embarked on a transformative journey as a community moderator and contributor for the pioneering Lisk blockchain platform in the cryptocurrency industry. In 2018, James was honored with the prestigious title of Community Member of the Year at the Liskies, an esteemed award ceremony celebrating outstanding achievements within the Lisk community.

James’s joined GNY in 2018 as part of the communications and marketing team. James has been a valuable asset to the GNY team, consistently delivering exceptional results through his innovative marketing strategies and captivating campaigns. His contributions have played a vital role in the successful launch of various GNY products and utilities, enhancing the overall user experience of our blockchain and machine learning capabilities. James managed the communications for all of GNY’s major projects, from the launch of its wallet, the GNY swap gate, GNY Range Report and the LMLGNY swap.

Throughout each milestone, James has demonstrated a strong commitment to effective communication and community support. He prioritizes clear and concise messaging, ensuring that all stakeholders understand the value andbenefits of GNY’s offerings. He actively engages with the community, encouraging feedback, and actively involving stakeholders in the GNY project. By doing so, James not only fosters collaboration but also gains valuable insights that help shape the direction of the project. This open an adaptable approach ensures that GNY remains responsive to the needs and expectations of its user base.

Combining his outgoing nature, extensive background in communication, passion for community development, and expertise in blockchain and machine learning technology, James continues to play a pivotal role within the GNY ecosystem. His contributions include fostering growth, facilitating connections, and empowering individuals and groups. James’s multifaceted skills and unwavering commitment make him an invaluable asset, driving the growth and success of GNY.

Debbie Quemard – Administrator & Money Laundering Officer

Debbie is entrusted with a multitude of vital roles within GNY. As the supervisor of accounts production and credit control procedures, she plays a crucial role in ensuring the smooth financial operations of the company.

Additionally, Debbie serves as the Compliance Officer and Money Laundering Compliance Officer (MLCO), shouldering the responsibility of upholding regulatory standards and safeguarding against illicit financial activities.

Debbie’s extensive qualifications and professional affiliations underscore her expertise and commitment to excellence. She holds an International Diploma in Compliance, a Certificate in Fund Administration, and is a distinguished fellow of the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants. Furthermore, Debbie is a valued member of the Society of Trust and Estate Practitioners, further highlighting her depth of knowledge in trust and estate matters.

With her impressive credentials and unwavering dedication to compliance and financial integrity, Debbie is an indispensable asset to the GNY team.
Her astute supervision and adherence to regulatory standards ensure the company’s financial operations run smoothly, while her expertise in trust and estate matters adds a layer of expertise and insight to her role.

Sebastian Hensch Reynard – Head Graphic Designer

Sebastian (Sebi) is a talented designer and 3D generalist from Buenos Aires, Argentina. His creative work is a testament to his deep fascination with cyberculture and influences from iconic movies like Blade Runner 2049, captivating books like Neuromancer, and even the visionary photography of Liam Wong.

Drawing inspiration from these diverse sources, Sebastian crafts visually stunning creations that bring the new gny.io style guidelines to life, which he affectionately refers to as “THE GNYVERSE.”

Sebastian’s artistic journey began in 2017, initially focused on architectural visualizations. However, he soon discovered his true passion lay in the realm of 3D design, particularly in crafting sci-fi and cyberpunk-inspired environments.

Through his captivating visuals, Sebastian seeks to establish a connection with the community, inviting them to embark on the mesmerizing visual journey of GNY.IO.

With an acute eye for detail and a profound understanding of design principles, Sebastian’s creations transcend traditional boundaries and immerse viewers in a world of futuristic aesthetics. His work serves as a gateway, inviting individuals to explore and engage with the captivating universe of GNY.IO.

Prepare to be captivated by Sebastian’s unparalleled talent as he weaves together elements of cyberculture, science fiction, and cutting-edge design.

Through his captivating visuals, he invites you to join him on a thrilling visual journey into the dynamic world of GNY.IO.
